bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Wade Hampton Frost, May 2, 1930

div1.p: Carter wonders where to send the bills for maps prepared for the History of Yellow Fever.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Wade Hampton Frost, May 2, 1930
div1.opener:
Frost
re
Book, Misel. maps.
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
May 2, 1930.
Dr. Wade H. Frost,
School of Hygiene and Public Health,
615 North Wolfe Street,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Dear Jack:
div1.p:
To whom should bills be sent for (a) final work on our two partiamlly
drawn maps and (b) for the third map, which you decided ought to be
drawn to illustrate the expeditions of Ojeda, Nicuesa et al? To yourself, I
imagine. This because Dr. Russell stated, in a letter of December 11/29,
that he was writing to you with regard to funds for the book, as there was
no budget item for it for 1930 and that “with this knowledge Dr. Frost
can arrange his work to fit our accounting system.”

The maps have not yet been inked in, although the additional
names suggested by yourslef and Dr. Ramsey have been added in pencil for the
first two and the third map is now ready for a final checking and inking
in.

I assume, from a statement of yours last December, that you do not
care to see these maps again before they are inked in. If I am in error,
please advise me.
